answers.answer: i am vomitting uncontrollable and going number 2 at least 3 times a day, are those early signs of labor?
well if the throwing up dont put you into labour then id say the dehydration will!! Good luck hun..keep us posted!

Leighanne143-I'm not sure~ I just remember with my son, I was vomiting, but it was NOTHING like now.  I was only alittle, with nausea.  I didn't have BM problems...but I had him 3 days later with my MP coming out the day before i had him and contractions for 2 days before as well....  But my vomiting is possible pre-eclampsia because it's servere.  Diaharrea (sp?) was a issue 3 times yesterday, that's it.  I haven't eatten in 2 days, so I have nothing to come out...LOL  When is your due date?Rosa-That's what they were telling me.  I just felt super bad for the baby and worried that something bad might happen to it.  My Mom was mad that they didn't keep me, then made sure the tests came back fine before sending me home.  I better hear something today.  I'm not even sure who would call me. My doctor isn't in town until the 9th...so i don't know who to call about my results if I don't hear anything by this afternoon.I seriously thought there were times my waters were going to break or have bleeding because that vomiting was AWEFUL!

that is just awful, I hope you feel better soon. I agree with your mother you should not have been send home, you need and the baby need to be monitored closely. U should call them and ask for the result if you dont hear anything from them by noon.Hope you have the baby soon,  Good luck.
Oh man... I really hope that you can go back to the hospital for some more monitoring (or an induction?  :)  ).  I will pray that this situation doesn't turn bad on you and baby!

Thanks~Do I call L&D??  My doctor isn't on call and I was up at L&D when they were doing the testing.  It's now 1:35pm and I still didn't hear anything.  I'm actually feeling worse.  The vomiting has stopped, but I've NEVER dizzy, nauseous, headaches and my eyes are SO sore....I don't know what to do!!!!
they should induce you you are suffering

CALL L&D or get back to the hospital.  This is ridiculous, that they do not induce you now.  Don't they treat the mother as just as important as the life growing inside of them.  It's time for this baby to be born, so mommie can recover.I'm worried about you, girl.Heather

Girl, they should definitely at least be keeping you there at the hospital to monitor you and the baby I agree with Heather, its ridiculous. I would call them and head back there and demand at least monitoring for your safety and your babys. You don't sound well at all and need to get back to that hospital!Keep us posted, I hope everything goes well! XOXO

I called and was told I'd get a call back within a next couple hours...well, THEY'RE OFFICE IS CLOSED!  I'm so P*SSED!!  Hopefully nothing happens tonight, that I sleep good and seeing that doctor tomorrow will give me SOME idea as to what is going on.So sorry this keeps happening to me.  I'm just as frustrated about it all as you are.  I'm doing ok as of now, but taking it easy~I don't even want to start stressing, that's the last thing I need.Thank you all for your kind words and letting me know what I should do~I'm trying...

brandi- sorry that you are going through this.  it seems like your doctors office is not the most capable place.  my due date is 2/23, so i have a few more weeks but i was worried that i was showing no signs of him coming and then started reading that my vomitting, flu like symptoms, and many BM's are all signs of early labor.

Like I am sure Brandi will agree, vomiting, diahhrea, feeling like you are coming down with something and peeing even more, are all signs that the end of pregnancy is near.  They can also be warning signs of pre eclmapsia if they are accompanied by headaches, swelling and blurred vision.  So pre-eclampsia is nothing to play around with.  It's dangerous.Anytime you have any of these changes late in pregnancy, it warrants a call to the doctor.  Keep a check on baby's movements also.  If you are feeling bad, it's most likely the baby is not feeling well either.  Especially when you know that their heart rate is higher than normal.  As Brandi's baby shows.  Mommie doesn't feel good, so baby doesn't feel good.  This can stress the baby out, so call your doctor if you are worried about ANYTHING.  That's what you pay them for.  You and the baby are too precious, to ignore, no matter what time of the night it is.  OB's are use to calls in the middle of the night.  It's part of their job.Brandi...keep us udpated if you can.  Many prayers are going up for you and the baby.  I know your DH is worried too, so tell him that I will include him in my prayers also.Big Mommie Hugs,Heather

I just got back home been runing around all day. Cannot believe that they did nto get back with you. I hope you feel better, if you dont u should go back to the hosptial and demand some answer. Hope you feel better soon.

Brandi,I am so worried about you.Go back to the L&D. Refuse to move. Vomit on the Dr!  You should not have been discharged - at very least you should have been admitted for close observation.  Tell them how bad you're feeling.  Exaggerate, if necessary - but I reckon they are blind dumb and stupid not to consider your symptoms as very serious.   Have hubbie throw a fit. Have your mother throw a fit. This is your and your baby's health we're talking about.  Preeclampsia is very serious! Even without the protein in your urine your symptoms are alarming.On a positive side, the vomitting and diarrhoea mean that things are very close to happening.Time to get this baby out. I agree 100% with Heather and all the rest.  Sounds like your doctors are less than competent.Keep us informed if you can.  Thinking and praying for you and the baby.

I'm back from my appointment.  The doctor I seen today was the Cheif of OB...I talked to him about my results and he said everything came back fine~That my potasium (sp?) was low, but everything came back fine!!  So I'm alittle better about that, but what's going on with me still?About 1:30 this morning, I wasn't feeling quiet right.  I started getting those fun contractions and cramping.  But it's so like me to have these anyways.  During my appointment, the doctor took his hands, placed them around the baby's shoulders and pulled upward?!  OMG that freakin' hurt.  I was ok until then.  Now I'm cramping like heck, having TONS of pressure ...back labor contractions and just not feeling good.  There's times when I can't more because I'm in so much pain!!!!!!Anyone have a doctor do that to them?  What was it all about~DAMN!!!So he told me that I could go anyday (DUH, I have 10 days left), The baby is full engaged (DUH), and it weights 8lbs 10oz to 9 pounds right now....funny because that's what my doctor told me before he left for vacation.OMG these REALLY HURT!!!  I don't if what I'm feeling is for real or what~but it sure feeling like it.....I didn't get a internal because they want to wait until my doctor comes back.  He's back on Monday, but my appointment it's until Thursday in the afternoon!!  BUT I promised I'll see him on the 9th being in labor~He told me his on call that night too...LOLI really feel like i can go soon~within the next 2 days or so....I PRAY!  I could have a 10 pounder by the end of all this....I asked aobut my delivery with my son, how I had a VERY hard time with him and he reassured me that I'll be wonderful!  That i won't need an episodomy or the vaccuum...(We'll see), but it was cool that he was nice enough to tell me that with every delivery, it's easier and quicker then the last~he told me not to guarentee what he was saying, but that's his guess.  I have scar tissue where my last one was and I KNOW I'll end up having one or tearing REALLY BAD!But, just happy he atleast was truthful and answered my question.  My original doctor wouldn't even guess or tell me I'll be fine.  He just asked how big the twins were!?!  It was confusing....So, OBVIOUSLY, I'll be going soon....hopefully sooner then 10 days :)  I called into work for Saturday~i can't believe they were still scheduling me!!  WTH??  But that's just a HUGE relief off my shoulders!!
Your poor body sounds like it really wants to have this baby now! Hope baby comes very soon! All this worry and then the calm will soon follow. Wishin' you well! Carlene :)

Sounds like things are moving.I think you will be sooner than 10 days.Hope this weekend is it for you.  Maybe after work on Sat!  You poor thing!  Still working and feeling like *rap.Take care hon!  Can't wait to hear that your baby is here.S

I was rocking on my birthing ball again lastnight and this morning.I'm HATING these period like feelings.  I'm just hoping it's really something.  I woke up again all pukey and nauseous, my thighs hurting like hell, lower back aches, tiny contractions....just like AF signs...it's really getting to me!I'm just going to stop writing on here because I bet you're all just sick of hear the same thing over and over again as I am of feeling it.  So when something REALLY happens, I'll come back on.  Hopefully it's this weekend~Thank you all

Oh Brandi,I'm sorry for all the stuff that is going on at the drs office.  Good to hear that you are having AF symptoms ;)  I'm hoping this is the end of the line for your pregnancy, since you are so miserable!much love from all of us,Kati

Hon,we're not sick of hearing from you.  Actually we like to hear from you so that we know that you're still ok despite feeling like c*%p!The AF like feelings are a sign too.  Means things are getting close.  I had those in the last couple of days before baby came.What a relief it's going to be when your baby is finally safely here.You know, we're all here cheering you on and praying for you.Take care.Sally

Thanks Girls~I'm just sick of updating everything then the next day everything stopping!!I've been VERY busy this morning, trying to clean and get things organized.  Yesterday I was SO SORE and tired...Nothing is happening really now.  It's depressing...atleast I didn't have to work :)I'm still crampy but nothing like yesterday.  I was really excited yesterday that things were happening.  But like my Grandmother said, "It'll come when it's ready, don't rush it..."  This is the farthest I've made it with a pregnancy~I just don't want it getting too big!  LOLEven though I see my doctor Thursday, I think we're going tocall down Monday when he's back and tell him what's been happening...he'll probably induce~Watch it be Thursday.  LOLIf anything else happens that's NEW, I'll update :)Thanks girls~Hoping my turn is SOON!♥Brandi♥

question: Well, as you all know, on Tueday (2-2-09) my husband got out of work early and decided to take me to the hospital because of my nausea, some what vomiting and swelling.  I did get a internal and all and I'm 2cm and 70% effaced.  The nurses weren't sure if it was the start of early labor (nausea and vomiting) or if it was Pre-Eclampsia or the Flu....So I was sent home seeing that the baby and I were find. My urine came back clean that night.WELL....we got home about 7pm that night and by 9:30 hit, I have vomiting uncontrolably...FOR 15 HOURS!!!  Diaharrea started only a couple times, but obviously that was due from me not having any food.  I couldn't hold anything down, so we went right to L&D.  I was just there 15-16 hours prior, so they knew something was going on.  I gave my first urine sample and it came back showing protien.  GREAT!!!!!!!  I was hooked up to the montior and the baby's heartrate was betwen 178-198, then would disappear with every contraction.  I was freaking out.  I was given 2 IV bags of solution, stayed at the hospital for 7 hours to wait myself and the baby and gave a second urine sample.  I won't hear anything about this sample until later today because it was the sterile cup.I was sent home to just REST, drink TONS of water and to follow the "BRATT" Diet....Bananas, rice, applesauce, Toast and Tea.  So if I hear anything else, I'll come on and let you all know.I have to put my son on the bus right now~Be back later-Hope everyone else is doing fine-Brandi
title: My last 2 days in the hopsital~
